intro: Barrowia jasminiflora, commonly known as the jasmine-flowered barrowia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
